intro: Alyxia spanogheana, commonly known as the Spanish bayonet, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its narrow, sword-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white or pink flowers. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and arid conditions. Alyxia spanogheana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in challenging environments.
